results.title: The Magna Carta. Part 1. The Rise of the English monarchy
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The reigns of William the Conqueror, Henry I, Stephen of Bois, Henry Plantagenet and Richard the Lionheart are dramatised in this film which traces the history of England from the Norman invasion in 1066 to the crowning of King John in 1199. The background of feudalism - against which the drama of English kings and barons was portrayed - sets the scene for the famous meeting at Runnymede which resulted in Magna Carta. The film was shot as far as possible on the actual locations of these historical events.
results.title_for_label: The Magna Carta. Part 1. The Rise of the English monarchy

results.title: The Magician
results.creator_credit: Tadeusz Makarczynski, Walter Reade, Semafor Studios and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: An anti-war film in the form of an allegory. A magician attracts a group of children at a beach. At first he amuses them with innocent tricks but gradually they are led into playing with guns, the guns finally become real.

results.title: The Magical world of J.K. Rowling
results.creator_credit: Steven Grant and Video Release Productions
results.brief_description: Winner of the British Book Awards prestigious Author of the Year award in 1999, J.K. (Joanne Kathleen) Rowling, a single mother with a young daughter, is responsible for creating one of the most popular children’s series in modern times. Her tales of young wizard Harry Potter, and his adventures at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry have been translated into 25 different languages. This documentary discusses where the idea for Harry came from and where it all began. Also includes interviews with childhood friends of the author, literary critics, bookstore owners and children, asking for their views on the Harry Potter phenomenon.

results.title: The Magic touch
results.creator_credit: Mushir Ahmad, V. Shantaram and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: A visual impression of Indian arts and crafts, recording the skill of the country’s artisans. Shows filigree from Cuttack and Hyderabad, the enamelled brassware of Moradabad, Jaipur and Lucknow, bronze figures from South India, ivory models wrought in Mysore and Travancore, the papiermache work from Kashmir.

results.title: The Magic square
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and General Learning Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents basic mathematical concepts. Crow and the Count travel to Scotland to claim an inherited castle. The benefactor has left a fortune to the person who can solve the mystery of the magic square. This the two friends do after much juggling of numbers; the reshuffling illustrates the interchangeability of addends in an addition equation (associative property). Previewing recommended for follow-up work for teachers. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Magic Roundabout
results.brief_description: The Magic Roundabout is about Mr. Rusty’s magic garden. He’s 100 years old and moves very fast because there’s always something to do. Then there’s Mr. Zebedee, the magic Jack-in-the-Box. He brings Florence and the other children to the garden to meet Dougal, the lovable but temperamental Scottie dog, Dylan the laid-back rabbit, Ermintrude the delightful felt hatted cow, and Brian the happy-go-lucky snail.

results.title: The Magic Paintbrush
results.brief_description: A charming puppet animation based on a Chinese folk-tale. Ma Liang, the hero, is a poor peasant boy who loves to paint. One day a fairy gives him a magic paintbrush and he discovers that anything he paints will come to life. Ma Liang happily creates many things that the peasants desperately need until, one fateful day, a wicked landlord discovers his secret.

results.title: The Magic of Coronation Street: distant memories 1960-64
results.brief_description: Six early episodes of the world’s longest-running television drama serial created by Tony Warren, and set in a fictional street in working-class Manchester. Beginning in 1960, “Coronation Street” cast of characters included the haughty Annie Walker, formidable matriarch Ena Sharples, busybody Hilda Ogden and her layabout husband Stan, the ordinary Barlow family and tartish Elsie Tanner. The sixties episodes, despite their primitive production values, were much more in the mould of the hard-edged, realistic drama that established Granada’s reputation, than more recent ‘soapier’ seasons. This collection features the first episode, screened in the UK on December 9th, 1960, two episodes each from 1961 (screened February 9th, Christmas Day) and 1962 (screened July 11th, December 12th) and one from 1964 (screened December 23rd).

results.title: The Magic mineral
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Tim Wilson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An interesting film from an historical point of view taking into account what we now know about the dangers to humans from breathing in or working around asbestos. At the time this film was made (1959), Canada was a major source of the world’s supply of asbestos. In the Province of Quebec, where the largest deposits were located, thriving communities grew up around the extraction and processing of asbestos. We see a typical town, Thetford Mines, and all the stages the fibrous rock goes through from mine to mill.
